t: Psalm 45
Your Throne, O God, Is Forever
To the choirmaster: according to Lilies. A Maskil of the Sons of Korah; a love song.
My*pn heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I*ld address my verses to the king; my*ld tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe.
You*pn are the most handsome of the sons of men; grace*ld is poured upon your lips; therefore*ld God has blessed you forever.
Gird*ln your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in*ld your splendor and majesty!
In*pn your majesty ride out victoriously for*ld the cause of truth and meekness and righteousness; let*ld your right hand teach you awesome deeds!
Your*ln arrows are sharp in*ld the heart of the king’s enemies; the*ld peoples fall under you.
Your*pn throne, O God, is forever and ever. The*ld scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of uprightness;
you*ld have loved righteousness and hated wickedness. Therefore*ln God, your God, has anointed you with*ld the oil of gladness beyond your companions;
your*ld robes are all fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia. From*ln ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad;
daughters*ld of kings are among your ladies of honor; at*ld your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.
Hear,*pn O daughter, and consider, and incline your ear: forget*ld your people and your father’s house,
and*ld the king will desire your beauty. Since*ln he is your lord, bow to him.
The*ld people of Tyre will seek your favor with gifts, the*ld richest of the people.
All*pn glorious is the princess in her chamber, with robes interwoven with gold.
In*ld many-colored robes she is led to the king, with*ld her virgin companions following behind her.
With*ln joy and gladness they are led along as*ld they enter the palace of the king.
In*pn place of your fathers shall be your sons; you*ld will make them princes in all the earth.
I*ln will cause your name to be remembered in all generations; therefore*ld nations will praise you forever and ever.
